alert.note: Alert for Poweshiek (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 6:25AM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Poweshiek and southern Tama Counties through 700 AM CDT... At 624 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Toledo, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northern Poweshiek and southern Tama Counties, including the following locations... Victor, Toledo Municipal Airport, Hartwick, Holiday Lake, Chelsea and Montour. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 202 and 204. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
